page.title: 05Churches in Hungerford.
page.content: St.Lawrence's Church of England is the largest church in Hungerford. Founded in 1108 by a Norman Abbot, it collapsed in 1811 and was rebuilt in in 1888.Many older monuments survived and can still be seen today .The windows are of stained glass; a replacement would take between 6 months and a year to complete. Every Sunday there are four services and a Sunday School.Special services held annually include the Christingle at Christmas,the Harvest Festival in in the autumn and the Constable Service held just after Easter. Hungerford also has a Methodist Chapel , a United Reform Church and a Roman Catholic Church.Christians from the different denominations do have regular contact with each other.
